alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 12:13AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Randolph County through 1245 AM CST... At 1213 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Doniphan to Maynard to near Attica. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocahontas... Reyno... Maynard... Biggers... Attica... Elkins Park... Brakebill... Middlebrook... Warm Springs... Ingram... Hamil... Stokes... Engelerg... Brockett... Pitman... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for eastern Arkansas.
